meanings.definition: A person who does tedious, menial, or unpleasant work.
meanings.sent1: The office drudge spent all day filing papers and answering phones.
meanings.sent2: The factory drudge worked tirelessly on the assembly line.
meanings.sent3: The drudge at the grocery store always had to deal with spilled milk cartons.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a drudge, carrying the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The image of the drudge scrubbing the floors was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: To do hard, menial, or tedious work.
meanings.sent1: He had to drudge through the muddy fields to harvest the crops.
meanings.sent2: She would drudge away at her homework until late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The children drudged through their chores, making a game out of it.
meanings.sent4: The writer drudged through countless drafts to perfect his novel.
meanings.sent5: The workers drudged on, knowing their efforts would pay off in the end.
